case_vignette: A 66-year-old man comes to the physician with a 4-month history of recurrent crusty lesions on the dorsal surface of his hands. When he scrapes off the crusts, they reappear after a few days. The lesions are mildly pruritic and occasionally burn. He works as a landscaper. A photograph of his right hand is shown.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got these crusty spots on the back of my hands that keep coming back a few days after I scrape them off.
Have you noticed any changes in the color or size of these spots?
They're a bit itchy sometimes and occasionally have a burning feeling.
Do these spots bleed or ooze any fluid after you scrape them off?
No, they don't bleed or ooze any fluid after I scrape them off.
How long have these spots been appearing on your hands?
They've been appearing for 4 months now.
Have you been exposed to a lot of sunlight or UV light in your daily activities?
Yes, I work as a landscaper, so I'm out in the sun quite a bit.
Do you use any protective measures, like sunscreen or gloves, while working outside?
No, I haven't been using any sunscreen or gloves while working.
Have you had any similar skin issues in the past or any other skin conditions diagnosed?
No, I haven't had any similar skin issues or diagnosed conditions before.
Do you have a family history of skin cancer or any other skin disorders?
I didn't say anything about my family's medical history, so I guess I don't know about that.
Are the crusty spots on your hands limited to one area or are they widespread?
They're just on the back of my hands.
Final Diagnosis: Actinic keratosis.
